title: Draynor Village

properties.value: Draynor Village is a small village located between Falador and Lumbridge. Draynor Village is under the administration of Varrock, due to the fact that it is part of the kingdom of Misthalin. Draynor Village offers a popular willow Woodcutting spot just south of the bank, stalls, and a master farmer to steal from.

Draynor Village is a small village located between Falador and Lumbridge. Draynor Village is under the administration of Varrock, due to the fact that it is part of the kingdom of Misthalin. Draynor Village offers a popular willow Woodcutting spot just south of the bank, stalls, and a master farmer to steal from.

Prior to the Vampyre Slayer quest, Draynor Village is terrorised by the vampyre Count Draynor, who lives in the large mansion north of the village.

Contents

    • 1.2 Marketplace

    • 1.6 Jail
    • 1.7 Diango's Workshop

  • 3 Personalities
  • 4 Music
  • 5 Changes
  • 6 References

Places of interest[edit | edit source]

North-eastern section and Rooftop Course[edit | edit source]

The north-eastern part of the village features several houses, with several residents who play a role in quests or run shops.

  • Morgan lives in the middle house on the eastern side of the village, slightly north-east of Aggie the Witch's house. Upstairs in his house, he stores a clove of garlic which can be taken from the cupboards.
  • Aggie the Witch lives in the westernmost house, and runs a dye shop. Players can buy dye from her provided they bring the requisite ingredients and pay her with coins. Her house also features spawns of a tomato and cheese.
  • Ned lives in the south-eastern house in the village, with his front door facing the village's jail. Players can trade him 4 balls of wool or pay him 15 coins for a coil of rope.
  • The slayer master Spria has a house in Draynor just north of the old Man's house.

This section also features the Draynor Village Rooftop Course, which requires level 10 Agility to traverse. This course runs all the way around these houses, starting at the furthest north-east house, and ending at Ned's house in the south-east.

Marketplace[edit | edit source]

Olivia at her seed stalls in the Draynor Marketplace.

The Draynor Village marketplace hosts three shops: Diango's Toy Store, Olivia's Seed Market and Fortunato's Fine Wine. With these shops, the marketplace features two thievable seed stalls and one thievable wine stall. These stalls are guarded by a pair of market guards, who attack players who attempt to steal from any of the market stalls, or players who talk to any stall owners just after thieving from their stalls.

In order to maximise the amount of stalls that can be thieved per hour, it is recommended to trap the two market guards in the Wise Old Man's house. This can be done by attacking them, then walking into the Old Man's house, and closing the door behind the guard. Players can walk up the stairs in order to remove aggression from the market guard afterwards. This can then be repeated for the second guard, keeping in mind that NPCs cannot walk through players, as long as no other players or NPCs stood inside the player before. This can be used to body block the first trapped guard while trapping the second guard. Using this method, players can expect much higher experience rates at the stalls in the marketplace.

The Wise Old Man's house[edit | edit source]

The Wise Old Man lives just across the street from the village's bank. He provides several services, such as checking your bank for leftover quest junk and sending players on small tasks for experience or item rewards. Upstairs in his house, he has a thing under his bed which he may request players to kill during these tasks.

There are several clues in his house that point towards him plotting to do something at the Wizards' Tower, such as his telescope pointing towards it. He also has strange books on the shelves, as well as large quantity of tinderboxes.

Draynor Sewers[edit | edit source]

The Draynor Sewers are a small underground area below the village, with two entrances. The first entrance can be found just north-west of Aggie the Witch's house, and the other is inside the Draynor Jail's compounds. Several zombies and skeletons inhabit this dungeon, with the former being featured in the easy Lumbridge & Draynor Diary, requiring the player to kill one in this location.

It also features an anvil, as well as a permanent fire, in a small chamber in the sewers. In this chamber, a weakened vampyre called Ruantun can be found, who plays a small role in the Desert Treasure quest.

Bank[edit | edit source]

The Wise Old Man robbing the bank.

The Draynor Village bank has a unique history, which is evident from the patched hole in the north-west corner of the building. Right beside the patched hole, a guard can be found sitting in a tree, as well as a bank guard standing beside the tree. These guards are placed there due to the robbery that took place in this bank. The guard in the tree offers to buy stew from players in exchange for 30 coins.

The bank also is one of the most popular locations for free-to-play players banking their willow logs, chopped from the trees just south-west of the bank. Note that this bank may not always be safe for players under level 14 combat, due to the fact it is possible to lure a level 7 dark wizard into the bank, who is aggressive to any players that are not more than twice his combat level.

Jail[edit | edit source]

On the east side of the village, Lady Keli runs a small jail, patrolled by several aggressive Jail guards. This is a multi-combat area, which makes this a very dangerous place for beginning players. Approaching from the east normally allows a quicker entry to the jail, with less exposure to the guards. This jail is mainly featured in the Prince Ali Rescue quest, where the player has to rescue the Al Kharid prince from this jail with the help of Leela, who is standing just north-west of the jail.

Within the compounds of the jail, a few nettles grow, which can be picked when wearing some form of gloves. Just west of the jail building, a second entrance to the Draynor Sewers can also be found.

Diango's Workshop[edit | edit source]

Diango's Workshop is where much of the 2014 Christmas event took place, and where players can go to get replacement marionettes. The workshop is located beneath a trapdoor in the most north-west house in Draynor Village, although players will not be able to enter the workshop unless an active event is taking place there. Attempting to enter will cause your character to say "There are no lights on downstairs in the basement, the pixies must have moved on. I hope I see them again." Players who have lost hats and scarves or yo-yos can talk to Diango to have them returned. The 2013 Halloween event also took place in Diango's Workshop, when players were rewarded with the Skeleton Costume and Jack lantern mask.

Skilling[edit | edit source]

Located just south of the bank, five willows grow in close proximity of each other, making this a very popular woodcutting location for free-to-play players. With the clear space just east of the trees, this is also a popular firemaking location for ironmen.

On the shore next to the trees, several net/bait fishing spots can be found, which can be used to catch either shrimps and anchovies, or sardine and herring.

In between these trees, two level 7 aggressive dark wizards roam, attacking any players under combat level 14. It is not advised to train woodcutting here with a lower combat, but these wizards can be killed to obtain runes, talismans, or a black robe.

Quests[edit | edit source]

The following quests may be started in and around Draynor Village:

Free-to-play quests[edit | edit source]

  • Vampyre Slayer may be started by speaking to Morgan in his house.

Members quests[edit | edit source]

  • The quests A Fairy Tale Part I - Growing Pains, and A Fairy Tale Part II - Cure a Queen may be started by speaking to Martin the Master Gardener, who is noted by his fancy Farming skillcape, in Draynor Market Square.
  • A Porcine of Interest may be started by reading the notice board on the wall behind Fortunato's Wine Stall.

In addition to these quests, several other quests heavily feature Draynor Village, such as Prince Ali Rescue taking place largely around the village jail, and Swan Song featuring the Wise Old Man prominently.

Personalities[edit | edit source]

  • Wise Old Man
  • Spria

  • Lady Keli

Music[edit | edit source]

Name Unlock details Music track
Unknown Land Unlocked in and around Draynor Village
Start Unlocked in northern Draynor Village
High Spirits Unlocked during the Halloween event
Diango's Little Helpers Unlocked in Diango's Workshop
Down Below Unlocked in the Draynor Sewers

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
24 March 2021
(update)

2021 Easter event: Added Easter event decorations and changed some doors to Easter event variants. Gregg can be found here at the holiday event icon on the world map and minimap.

5 March 2015
(update | poll)

There is now a shortcut between Draynor Village and Port Sarim that you can use at level 42 Agility if you have completed the Medium Lumbridge & Draynor Diary.

References[edit | edit source]

Prior to the [[Vampyre Slayer]] quest, Draynor Village is terrorised by the vampyre [[Count Draynor]], who lives in [[Draynor Manor|the large mansion]] north of the village. ==Places of interest== ===North-eastern section and Rooftop Course=== The north-eastern part of the village features several houses, with several residents who play a role in quests or run shops. *[[Morgan]] lives in the middle house on the eastern side of the village, slightly north-east of [[Aggie|Aggie the Witch]]'s house. Players can trade him 4 [[ball of wool|balls of wool]] or pay him 15 [[coins]] for a coil of [[rope]]. *The slayer master [[Spria]] has a house in Draynor just north of the old Man's house. This section also features the [[Draynor Village Rooftop Course]], which requires level 10 [[Agility]] to traverse. This course runs all the way around these houses, starting at the furthest north-east house, and ending at [[Ned]]'s house in the south-east. ===Marketplace=== [[File:Draynor Seed Market.png|thumb|right|[[Olivia]] at her seed stalls in the Draynor Marketplace.]] The Draynor Village marketplace hosts three shops: [[Diango]]'s [[Diango's Toy Store|Toy Store]], [[Olivia]]'s [[Draynor Seed Market|Seed Market]] and [[Fortunato]]'s [[Wine Shop.|Fine Wine]]. With these shops, the marketplace features two thievable [[seed stall]]s and one thievable [[wine stall]]. These stalls are guarded by a pair of [[Market Guard (Draynor)|market guards]], who attack players who attempt to steal from any of the market stalls, or players who talk to any stall owners just after thieving from their stalls. In order to maximise the amount of stalls that can be thieved per hour, it is recommended to trap the two market guards in the [[Wise Old Man]]'s house. This can be done by attacking them, then walking into the Old Man's house, and closing the door behind the guard. Players can walk up the stairs in order to remove aggression from the market guard afterwards. This can then be repeated for the second guard, keeping in mind that [[NPCs]] cannot walk through players, as long as no other players or NPCs stood inside the player before. This can be used to body block the first trapped guard while trapping the second guard. Using this method, players can expect much higher experience rates at the stalls in the marketplace. ===The [[Wise Old Man]]'s house=== The [[Wise Old Man]] lives just across the street from the village's bank. He provides several services, such as checking your bank for leftover quest junk and sending players on [[Wise Old Man tasks|small tasks]] for experience or item rewards. Upstairs in his house, he has a [[thing under the bed|thing under his bed]] which he may request players to kill during these tasks. There are several clues in his house that point towards him plotting to do something at the [[Wizards' Tower]], such as his telescope pointing towards it. He also has strange books on the shelves, as well as large quantity of [[tinderbox]]es. ===Draynor Sewers=== The Draynor Sewers are a small underground area below the village, with two entrances. The first entrance can be found just north-west of [[Aggie|Aggie the Witch]]'s house, and the other is inside the Draynor Jail's compounds. Several [[zombie]]s and [[skeleton]]s inhabit this dungeon, with the former being featured in the easy [[Lumbridge & Draynor Diary]], requiring the player to kill one in this location. It also features an [[anvil]], as well as a permanent fire, in a small chamber in the sewers. In this chamber, a weakened [[vampyre]] called [[Ruantun]] can be found, who plays a small role in the [[Desert Treasure]] quest. ===[[Bank]]=== [[File:Draynor Bank Robbery.png|thumb|right|The [[Wise Old Man]] robbing the bank.]] The Draynor Village bank has a unique history, which is evident from the patched hole in the north-west corner of the building. Right beside the patched hole, a [[Tree (Draynor guard)|guard]] can be found sitting in a tree, as well as a [[bank guard]] standing beside the tree. These guards are placed there due to the [[Draynor Bank Robbery|robbery]] that took place in this bank. The guard in the tree offers to buy stew from players in exchange for 30 coins. The bank also is one of the most popular locations for [[free-to-play]] players banking their [[willow logs]], chopped from the trees just south-west of the bank. Note that this bank may not always be safe for players under level 14 combat, due to the fact it is possible to lure a level 7 [[dark wizard]] into the bank, who is aggressive to any players that are not more than twice his combat level. ===Jail=== On the east side of the village, [[Lady Keli]] runs a small jail, patrolled by several [[aggressive]] [[Jail guard]]s. This is a [[multi-combat area]], which makes this a very dangerous place for beginning players. Approaching from the east normally allows a quicker entry to the jail, with less exposure to the guards. This jail is mainly featured in the [[Prince Ali Rescue]] quest, where the player has to rescue the [[Al Kharid]] prince from this jail with the help of [[Leela]], who is standing just north-west of the jail. Within the compounds of the jail, a few [[nettle]]s grow, which can be picked when wearing some form of [[gloves]]. Just west of the jail building, a second entrance to the Draynor Sewers can also be found. ===Diango's Workshop=== [[Diango]]'s Workshop is where much of the [[2014 Christmas event]] took place, and where players can go to get replacement [[marionette]]s. The workshop is located beneath a trapdoor in the most north-west house in Draynor Village, although players will not be able to enter the workshop unless an active event is taking place there. Attempting to enter will cause your character to say "There are no lights on downstairs in the basement, the pixies must have moved on. I hope I see them again." Players who have lost [[hats and scarves]] or [[yo-yo]]s can talk to [[Diango]] to have them returned. The [[2013 Halloween event]] also took place in Diango's Workshop, when players were rewarded with the [[Skeleton Costume]] and [[Jack lantern mask]]. ===Skilling=== Located just south of the bank, five [[willow]]s grow in close proximity of each other, making this a very popular [[woodcutting]] location for free-to-play players. With the clear space just east of the trees, this is also a popular [[firemaking]] location for [[ironmen]]. On the shore next to the trees, several [[small fishing net|net]]/[[fishing bait|bait]] [[fishing spot]]s can be found, which can be used to catch either [[shrimp]]s and [[anchovies]], or [[sardine]] and [[herring]]. In between these trees, two level 7 aggressive [[dark wizard]]s roam, attacking any players under [[combat level]] 14. It is not advised to train woodcutting here with a lower combat, but these wizards can be killed to obtain runes, talismans, or a [[black robe]]. ==Quests== The following [[quests]] may be started in and around Draynor Village: ===Free-to-play quests=== *[[Vampyre Slayer]] may be started by speaking to [[Morgan]] in his house. ===Members quests=== *The quests [[A Fairy Tale Part I - Growing Pains]], and [[A Fairy Tale Part II - Cure a Queen]] may be started by speaking to [[Martin the Master Gardener]], who is noted by his fancy [[Farming skillcape]], in Draynor Market Square. *[[A Porcine of Interest]] may be started by reading the notice board on the wall behind Fortunato's Wine Stall.
